conclusion: To determine the temperature of the gas at state B, we can use the ideal gas law and the properties of the processes shown in the p-V diagram.
At state A: Pressure p_A = 3 x 10^5 Pa, Volume V_A = 1 x 10^-3 m³, Temperature T_A = 27°C = 300 K.
At state B: Pressure p_B = 1 x 10^5 Pa, Volume V_B = 1 x 10^-3 m³.
The ideal gas law is given by pV = nRT.
Relate the states using the ideal gas law: (p_A V_A) / T_A = (p_B V_B) / T_B.
Substitute the known values: (3 x 10^5) x (1 x 10^-3) / 300 = (1 x 10^5) x (1 x 10^-3) / T_B.
The temperature of the gas at state B is 100 K.
